Globalism is an interesting subject, but the author seems to be fairly ignorant of it. Modern day globalism and internationalism has undermined the democratic capabilities of the individual nation-state. While EU, and to a lesser extent, contemporary UN has been created in response of this change. If we do not respond to an increasing amount of problems and societees being global or internationalized, rather than concentrated in individual nation-states or territories we will eventually loose our democratic ability to choose our own way of life. That is why nation-states choose to co-operate in inter-national and sometimes supra-national organisations. 
 
 The author also seem completly ignorant of the meaning of sustainable development. Sustainable development means "a devleopment that satisfies our needs, without endangering the need-satisfication of comming generations" and this may be reached in a nu,ber of ways.
